item.description:
@iceman327 wrote:

This a very nasty way to make it so people can not equip items.
Also lags server a huge amount.

What you should do is find your CLStrength void in your client.java,
And just add the Skill Cape ID into that

item.title: SKILLCAPE Problem. I thought I fixed, but it didn't
item.dc:creator: @monger monger
item.description:
@monger wrote:

Change it to this:

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14073 == true) {// Evan`
        
        if (playerLevel[0] <= 98 && playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14073) { // If you are lvl 98 or lower you cannot wear cape!
            remove(playerEquipment[playerCape], 1);
            sendMessage("You Need 99 attack To Wear This Cape!");
        } 
}

You were ending your if has skill cape function before you put in the if level part.

Read full topic

item.title: SKILLCAPE Problem. I thought I fixed, but it didn't
item.dc:creator: @Morgarath Morgarath
item.description:
@Morgarath wrote:

Hey. I added the skill cape thing under public boolean, but it has no effect… heres the code:

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14073 == true) {// Evan` } if (playerLevel[0] <= 98 && playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14073) { // If you are lvl 98 or lower you cannot wear cape! remove(playerEquipment[playerCape], 1); sendMessage("You Need 99 attack To Wear This Cape!"); }

I dont get any errors or anything.

This is for attack cape… however, it doesn’t have any effect.
